definition: to stop work/to shut down/to stop production

sentences.english: This proactive alert enables you to accelerate the recovery from downtimes.
sentences.chinese: 这种积极主动的提醒，您可以加快恢复停工。

sentences.english: What do you do in your downtime?
A planned construction project has been halted to allow a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 为进行全面调查，规划好的一项建设工程已经停工。

sentences.english: However, employees are not paid for the downtime.
sentences.chinese: 但是没有给员工支付停工待料工资。

sentences.english: A severe natural gas shortage shut down many plants.
sentences.chinese: 天然气的严重缺乏使许多家工厂都停工了。

sentences.english: We also use this period of scheduled downtime to apply patches.
sentences.chinese: 我们并且使用这个预定的停工期的期间应用补钉。

sentences.english: Then they promised to stop, but they secretly carried on.
sentences.chinese: 当时，他们承诺停工，但暗地里仍在施工。

sentences.english: It was the only time the N.B.A. had lost games to a labor stoppage.
sentences.chinese: 他是唯一一次NBA在劳工停工面前失利。

sentences.english: And when Baasha heard of it, he stopped building Ramah, and he lived in Tirzah.
sentences.chinese: 巴沙听见，就停工不修筑拉玛了，仍住在得撒。

sentences.english: Photovoltaic systems are also at less than 2 percent.
sentences.chinese: 光伏系统停工期同样不到2%。

sentences.english: It is time to pipe the sailors down.
sentences.chinese: 该是吹哨让海员们停工的时候了。

sentences.english: Computing rebates from network connectivity downtimes from your internet provider.
sentences.chinese: 计算退税的网络连接停工从您的互联网服务提供商。

sentences.english: The occasion for the citywide shutdown was an event most expect never to see again.
sentences.chinese: 像这样全市性停工的情况是大部分人从没有意料到的。

sentences.english: To the tower built to the third level, it is clear that tilt, once lay-off.
sentences.chinese: 到塔身建到第三层时，可显明看出倾斜，曾一度停工。

definition: to begin work (of a factory or engineering operation)/to start a construction job
to cease trading (temporarily or permanently)/to close down
(of a power plant, refinery etc) to shut down
construction/to carry out construction or large-scale repairs
to finish work/to complete a project
time allocated for a project/completion date
to work against the clock/to hurry with work to get it done in time
in arrears/behind in payments/to default on one's debts
to tear down/to demolish/to dismantle/to remove
to demolish a building and relocate the inhabitants
